name: Methylphenidate Hydrochloride
indications: methylphenidate hydrochloride chewable tablets indicated treatment : attention deficit hyperactivity disorder ( adhd ) patients 6 years age older narcolepsy
contraindications: pediatric patients 6 years older : start 5 mg twice daily ( breakfast lunch ) ; titrate dose weekly increments 5 mg 10 mg. daily dosages 60 mg recommended . ( 2.2 ) adults : administer divided doses 2 3 times daily , preferably 30 45 minutes meals . maximum recommended daily 60 mg. ( 2.2 ) administer least 8 ounces ( full glass ) water fluid . ( 2.2 )
warningsAndPrecautions: methylphenidate hydrochloride chewable tablet 2.5 mg available white off-white colored , grape flavored , rounded square shaped tablet convex surface , debossed “ τ ” “ chew ” one side “ 2.5 ” side . bottles 100 . . . . . . . . . ndc 64980-221-01 methylphenidate hydrochloride chewable tablet 5 mg available white off-white colored , grape flavored , rounded square shaped tablet convex surface , debossed “ τ ” “ chew ” one side “ 5 ” side . bottles 100 . . . . . . . . . ndc 64980-222-01 methylphenidate hydrochloride chewable tablet 10 mg available white off-white colored , grape flavored , scored rounded square shaped tablet convex surface , debossed “ τ ” bisect “ chew ” one side “ 10 ” side . bottles 100 . . . . . . . . . ndc 64980-223-01 protect moisture . dispense tight container child-resistant closure . storage : store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] .
adverseReactions: methylphenidate hydrochloride chewable tablets contraindicated patients : known hypersensitivity methylphenidate components methylphenidate hydrochloride chewable tablets . hypersensitivity angioedema anaphylactic reported patients treated methylphenidate [ ( 6 ) ] . receiving concomitant treatment monoamine oxidase inhibitors ( maois ) , also within 14 days following discontinuation treatment maoi , risk hypertensive crisis [ ( 7.1 ) ] .
indications_original:
Methylphenidate Hydrochloride Chewable Tablets is indicated for the treatment of:
                  
                     Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) in patients 6 years of age and older
                     Narcolepsy
contraindications_original: Pediatric Patients 6 Years and Older: Start with 5 mg twice daily (before breakfast and lunch); titrate the dose in weekly increments of 5 mg to 10 mg. Daily dosages above 60 mg are not recommended. ( 2.2 ) Adults: Administer in divided doses 2 or 3 times daily, preferably 30 to 45 minutes before meals. Maximum recommended daily dosage is 60 mg. ( 2.2 ) Administer with at least 8 ounces (a full glass) of water or other fluid. ( 2.2 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Each Methylphenidate Hydrochloride Chewable Tablet 2.5 mg is available as a white to off-white colored, grape flavored, rounded square shaped tablet with a convex surface, debossed with “τ” above “CHEW” on one side and “2.5” on the other side.
                  
                     Bottles of 100 . . . . . . . . . NDC 64980-221-01
                  
                  Each Methylphenidate Hydrochloride Chewable Tablet 5 mg is available as a white to off-white colored, grape flavored, rounded square shaped tablet with a convex surface, debossed with “τ” above “CHEW” on one side and “5” on the other side.
                  Bottles of 100 . . . . . . . . . NDC 64980-222-01
                  Each Methylphenidate Hydrochloride Chewable Tablet 10 mg is available as a white to off-white colored, grape flavored, scored rounded square shaped tablet with a convex surface, debossed with “τ” bisect “CHEW” on one side and “10” on the other side.
                  Bottles of 100 . . . . . . . . . NDC 64980-223-01
                  Protect from moisture. Dispense in tight container with child-resistant closure.
                  
                     
                     Storage: Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
adverseReactions_original:
Methylphenidate Hydrochloride Chewable Tablets is contraindicated in patients:
                  
                     with a known hypersensitivity to methylphenidate or other components of Methylphenidate Hydrochloride Chewable Tablets. Hypersensitivity reactions such as angioedema and anaphylactic reactions have been reported in patients treated with methylphenidate [see Adverse Reactions (6)].
                     receiving concomitant treatment with monoamine oxidase inhibitors (MAOIs), and also within 14 days following discontinuation of treatment with a MAOI, because of the risk of hypertensive crisis [see Drug Interactions (7.1)].
